snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo declared a state of emergency and closed roads in parts of the state, and travelers were told to expect transportation delays on Tuesday because of extreme cold and high winds.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo declares state of emergency and closes roads in parts of the state, and travelers are told to expect transportation delays because of extreme cold and high winds.

byline.contributor: Annie Correal and Emma G. Fitzsimmons contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo declared a state of emergency and closed roads in parts of the state, and travelers were told to expect transportation delays on Tuesday because of extreme cold and high winds.

headline.main: As New York Region Braces for Chill, Cuomo Declares Emergency
headline.print_headline: As New York Region Braces for Chill, Cuomo Declares Emergency
